column4: Hello I got this from a nother channel how can I check it " your ubuntu machine probably turned on iptables firewall by default"
did it say "(policy DROP)" without the quotes anywhere
there's nothing blocking anything on your system locally.
so iptables might not be your issue, but it IS there
its just not filtering anything.  its letting everything in to your system
The problem is that I have a server that is arping all my system 60 times /h
and i'm on a network that gets over 200 ARP hits every minute
i wouldnt worry about it unless you really want to filter out ARP
which is a pain and not a good idea
ok, just I'm running a splunk server and after I installed it I keep getting more arp req
how do you know you're getting those ARP requests... using wireshark or something?
my router logs them, and Splunks is a indexing server
the last H I have 2369 arps
ah, i dont think its anything to really worry about, i get 100s of ARP requests either my IP or just normal traffic on my network all the time.  ARP requests arent really going to pwn you
